description:
Au Contact is a miniature ruleset for modern day combat, using 15mm or 28mm miniatures primarily. It depicts the harsh realties of modern warfare at the skirmish level.

The rules are of medium-complexity, and can be adapted to solitaire play. There are two phases in one turn, an action phase (where platoons, squad and fireteams will shoot, move, use or repair equipments, etc), and management phase (where the players will heal their wounded, check morale, etc).

Troops are divided in different based on their preparation, and their willingness to fight. In today's war, stress level is an important component, which the game takes into account successfully. Night combat, fog of war, and civilian presence can also be added for more realism!

With 14 scenarios and 11 army lists (7 modern : American, British, French, Russian, different types of insurgents, and 4 Vietnam war lists), players have a wide variety of themes they can play with.

The players take turns one after the other.
Each player moves his pawn round the board, from hex to hex as per the die result.
Each hex describes an event and its result. You either gain or loose money.
Each player uses his money to buy plastic pieces that simulate oil facilities and place them on the 6 slots of his property which is drawn on the board. Those pieces are oil wells (2 piecess - slots), gas tanks (2 pieces - slots) and oil tanks (one small and one big, one slot each).
The player who accomplishes this first, wins the game.

–user summary

In the early 1990’s a Russian antarctic expedition began drilling through the ice to a fresh water Lake dubbed Lake Vostok.

On Feb 2012 they succeeded in drilling more than 2,000 miles. It took more than 30 years.

Many raised concerns of the risks of breaking a barrier to a lake sealed off between 15 and 34 million years. But someone made the call that breaking this barrier was worth the risk.

Because the quantity of oxygen in Lake Vostok exceeds anywhere on our planet by 10-20X. Scientists predicted they would find new species that evolved far differently than any seen before.

After the initial research was completed a conspiracy theory propagated online. One of the Russian scientists defected. He claimed a highly intelligent creature, a new organism, engaged with them and killed some team members. This is where our Vostok story begins.

After a distress signal was received an unprecedented storm cut all contact with Vostok Station. As the storm raged on without any signs of letting up, multiple recon teams were sent. Your team is the only one to make it. After crashing 10 clicks away, you arrive at the aftermath of a massacre. Early into the reconnaissance you realize the story of the station goes much deeper.

The game is based on a First Strike Combat System. Players must battle physically and meta physically. Players also learn to control insanity and weaponize it.

An AI is provided to assist your team to off-set the intelligence of the new organism. The AI assists in many ways including scientific, weapon and ammunition recipes.

There are several player characters to choose from with varying capabilities. Players are free to assemble the kind of team they prefer.

Your team must fully explore the Russian station, re-establish communications, report back on the status and insure the chamber to the lake is sealed. Your team wins if they can make it the chamber and confirm it is sealed.

—description from the publisher

It's the UNO matching card game everyone knows and loves but featuring graphics from the video game Sonic the Hedgehog. Players still race to get rid of all their cards by matching color, number and symbol, but when someone plays a Wild Victory Lap Card, all other players must draw one card! And when a player is down to one card, they can't forget to shout, "UNO!"

The improv party game! Players assume the role of Actors performing in improvised scenes that are (almost) completely unscripted.
Create hundreds of scenes on the fly on what's been described as "the improving actor's toolkit!"
Generate scenes by drawing a Relationship and Location card, and grab a secret Script card for each player. Actors that can use their script before their scene ends gain a victory point! The first to 5 victory points wins!

Woodland Craft is a competitive roll and write game of gathering and crafting. You will guide two animal friends around the Forest to gather Forest items in order to make crafts and score the most points before fall is over.

Woodland Craft is played in rounds with three phases per round.

     Roll Dice: At the beginning of each round, each pair of dice is rolled. If doubles are rolled for any of the pairs, all players fill in the next open space on their Fall Track.
     Move & Gather: Simultaneously, players will use any one of these pairs of dice to move one or both of their animal friends around the Forest to gather Forest items.
     Crafts & Shed: Player may use gathered Forest items to make crafts and/or place items in their Shed.


When one or more of the following conditions is met, finish the round and proceed to Final Scoring.

A promo card for Joking Hazard featuring the Red Ranger from Power Ranger. 
It was given out at San Diego Comic Con 2018

It's red bordered, so it is an end card. It may be only placed at the end of the comic.

This card was given out at Pensacon 2019.
It shows Green Skirt Guy telling that "they must be in Florida"

Animal rescuers gather objects and actions to rescue and release animals in need.  Each animal needs a different combination of cards to secure a positive rescue or release, with others unable to be released scoring negative points.  Each player has slightly different rules depending on their Meeple.  Vet cards throw a random element in typical of what is faced in animal rescue.

In addition, there are a range of map type score tracks your Meeple moves along, with bonus points to be picked up.

The game is asymmetrical in 2 ways - when each player rehomes their own animal type, they receive a different bonus.  Also, each animal player type moves differently -

- The dog player can take a shortcut through a dog agility tunnel
- The cat player can hop between adjacent cardboard boxes at no movement cost
- The rabbit player can move diagonally between obstacles as well as orthogonally
- The pigeon player can fly directly over and land on obstacles and fly over water

There will be 2 options for the board in the base game, additional Kickstart exclusive boards, and various expansions including a Horse Player (which can gallop on some moves), additional maps and different full versions of the game to come.  Be ready for a lot of twists on the theme and unexpected variants.

Game is designed by the CEO of Farplace Animal Rescue, an avid board gamer, and 100% of the profits will support animal rescue via Farplace.

Micro Architects is a 1-4 player, city building game which takes 30-60 minutes to play. As a city architect your role is to plan the layout of your city, build landmarks, provide services, manage residents and deal with random events that affect your city.

The game is played over 3 rounds with players scoring after each round. On your turn pick a building from the ones set up at the beginning of a round and place it on your city board and try to create patterns based on goal cards. When picking a landmark, take a landmark tile to go with it and try to fulfill its requirements. After filling up a whole district with buildings, gain a boat. 2 boats let you acquire a service for your city which makes it more attractive to the residents. After a round is completed score points in 3 ways:

GOALS - each pattern is worth a number of points
LANDMARKS - each landmark has a unique requirement for where it needs to be placed and what other buildings should it be surrounded by
SERVICES - each service provides points for a specific set of buildings in your city

At any point of your turn you are able to use construction tokens to demolish buildings and build them again in a different spot, use buildings from an additional building pool or have more choice when choosing the right service for your city.

RESIDENTS module

More advanced players will definitely want to play with an extra module that comes in the box - RESIDENTS.
This module adds an additional board to each player's city board where you place residents that come to your city. Residents allow you to score additional points, reuse your construction tokens and gain extra boats which in turn let you acquire more services for your city.

EVENT module

Spice things up with the event deck! Pick a card and see whether you’ll have to deal with an impending disaster or strike of good fortune. Disasters can ruin your plans if you don’t prepare for them in time and positive events might give you that extra boost on your path to victory.

The game ends after the scoring phase for round 3. The player with the most points is the winner and becomes the chief architect!

—description from the designer

The Portuguese canning industry developed throughout the 20th century, going through periods of great splendor and of extraordinary importance in the social fabric of communities close to fishing centers. After the huge growth due to the immense supply of troops in Europe that World War II brought, the industry went through a period of stability with the consolidation of the quality of the products and the establishment of markets abroad.

Lata ("tin can" in English) is the name of the raw material for the containers in which the fish is packed, and it also turned out to be a popular designation for the product. In this game, players manage local canning companies in the 1950s and produce and sell the famous canned sardines or canned mackerel, the two main canned fish in the first decades of the industry, before the appearance of the very popular tuna.

The game takes place over six rounds. In each round, players buy a batch of fish, tomato or olive oil, which they then can use in their factory. These preserves will then be sold to markets. This operation will result in money that will be used to buy scorecards and increase the factory's production capacity.

The order in which each batch of raw materials is chosen is given by an auction of action points that players secretly make by sliding their disk to the left on the action track of their individual board. Whoever gives up more opportunities for action chooses the best lot, but it is clear that having more possibilities for action is vital to produce more and reach the best markets!

The player with the most victory points (VP), which are awarded at the end of the game by the scorecards, wins.

Lata is the second game in the "Quinas Collection", following the success of Café, the first game in the line.

—description from the designer

This is a may follow trick-taker that features a hex board that players will be interacting with to score points.  Every trick will result in each player claiming a space on the board depending on their order in the trick and the cards played.

The trick winner will also get a potential bonus reward, mixing paints, for winning a trick.  Primary color cards that are played in a trick can be mixed to create a secondary color.

The player that scores the most points from their board positioning and color majorities from tiles collected will win the game.

A collection of self-contained small card mysteries, brain teasers, and mystery grams. The canister is filled with cards small enough fit in your pocket and ready to take anywhere anytime.

Players can tackle the visual puzzles solo or as teams. Each card is a self-contained mystery providing  isual and wordplay clues to solve individually.

Competitive players or teams can set a target number of cards to solve within a certain amount of time.

Players will become supporters of famous people who have passed away this year, and campaign to make their funerals as wonderful as possible.

However, in order for them to be given state funerals, the consent of the people is required. Now is the time to question the pros and cons of state funerals!

Players vote secretly on which celebrities will move up the ladder to the top. When a celebrity gets to the top of the ladder, players vote on whether the celebrity deserves a state funeral. Players score according to the end rank of the celebrities they secretly chose.

A card game with "trick-taking + draft elements" that uses the world view of the Werewolf game. It is a difficulty level for those with experience in trick taking.

After cards have been dealt, players passes two cards to their left ("drafting").

Players need to follow the lead suit ("trick-taking". Some of the cards have effects that will be resolved at the end of a trick.  When any player has one or less card in the their hand, the hand ends.  Every player then reveals cards remaining in their hands to determine whether Demon Fox, Villagers or Werewolves win ("Werewolf").  The winner side score victory points based on those remaining cards in their hand.

Elestrals is a brand new trading card game from the mind of Dan "aDrive" Clap. Dan and his team have been very involved with many different TCGs, like Pokemon.

In a game of Elestrals, your Spirit cards are your most important resource: they are your health and fuel when playing cards and attacking your opponent! Knowing when to use your Spirits and when to save them is a key strategy.

There are five types of Spirits. Most decks have a mix of different types, and the Elestrals and Runes that you Cast will often need specific Spirits or even combinations of them!

To get started, each player has to have the following:

     A Spirit deck with exactly 20 Spirits in it. You can mix and match different Spirits or play as many of the same ones as you like!
     A Main deck with exactly 40 cards in it. This is where your Runes and Elestrals go; you can only have up to three copies of any single card, so you need some variety.


And that’s it! You can look through your own Spirit Deck any time you like and ask your opponent how many cards are left in their Spirit Deck. But you never* get to look through your opponent’s decks, so you won’t know exactly which Spirits they have left. Once your Main Deck is shuffled at the start of a game, you can’t look through it unless a card tells you.

—description from the publisher

The call comes in, Engine House Number 9, there is a building on fire downtown. Upon arriving at the scene, it becomes clear to the firefighters that the fire is no ordinary fire. That most of the city is also on fire or has been leveled by a giant monster spitting flame and doing the Twist down 4th Street. Fire hoses and axes are not going to stop a monster, let the national guard handle that! Focus on putting out the fire in this high rise office building, chaps! Up the stairs, no power, keep those people safe!

In Towering Inferno, Roll and Write Revolution goes 3D! Just print, fold, and tape then you're ready to play!

The game sheet becomes a building with 3 or 4 sides for the players to mark the progress of the fire and their firefighters as they strive for the safety of the structure.

Each turn a pool of dice is roll and players select 1 die to act as their firefighter and one to act as their fire. The fire fighter has to enter the building then progress upward as they follow the path to save rooms and control the fire as it burns. The fire will burn downward or to the left or right ignoring paths, but avoiding rooms that have already been secured.

Players can also utilize the special powers of each side of the building they are on to help them move up or laterally. Clever play in this game finds the players having to plan for their moves but also plan for where the fire might go.

Can you secure the fire before the entire structure becomes a Towering Inferno? Or will your dreams go up in flames in this new roll and write game!

—description from the designer

Some of you are able to travel back in time and have become the Protagonists of stories that unfold terrible tragedies. You need to discover a way to stop the tragedies from occurring, but there is a Mastermind whose sole purpose is to make sure they unfold. Can you stop the tragedies before the last loop?!

In Tragedy Looper: New Tragedies, 1-3 players are Protagonists attempting to escape a time loop engineered by one player acting as the Mastermind. The Mastermind player selects a script, either one of the 13 scripts included or one created themselves, and sets up the game accordingly. The Protagonist players don't yet know the details of the tragic events about to unfold.

Protagonists and the Mastermind will play cards, activate abilities, and trigger incidents to uncover (or hide!) information and move the events forward. Players will interact with different characters and build relationships with them in order to unlock and activate those characters' helpful special abilities, but of course the Mastermind is attempting to trick and mislead the Protagonists. At the end of each loop, if the Protagonists haven't guessed correctly, they rewind all game components back to the start and try again with more information. If they don't guess correctly on the final loop, the Mastermind wins!

The Tragedy Looper system creates a unique game of deduction in which players begin each new loop better prepared, but the Mastermind player will know what they've learned and can alter their strategy accordingly.

Tragedy Looper: New Tragedies is a standalone game that brings content from original publisher BakaFire into English for the first time, collecting 13 scripts and 30 characters. This game includes a teaching guide for the Mastermind and a "First Steps" tragedy set for the first two scripts to help players get more comfortable with the gameplay loop. Experienced masterminds can also create their own scripts.

Get ready to play the most exciting game of questions! Ask up to 10 questions to guess what’s on the card. Think hard, ask intelligent questions, use your clue cards wisely & be the first person to win 7 game cards!

—description from the publisher

Surrounded by lush green plants and delicious fruits, the curious little sloth wants to explore the jungle. They usually move quite slowly – but then can suddenly disappear very quickly! Three movement-packed games let children follow the trail of the cute little sloth. This stimulates both fine and gross motor skills, association skills, and imagination. Who will be fastest to find the little sloth in one of their favorite spots? Brings movement to playing fun!

—description from the publisher

"Brrr, it's cold..." - this was your first thought when you blinked and looked around. The very previous moment, as you remembered, you and your daughter were at home, drinking hot
chocolate wearing your ugly Christmas sweaters, staring at the snowfall through the window, and waiting for the clock to hit midnight as usual on 30th November. But now, everything seemed so... frosty and strange.
- What on earth just happened? - your daughter asked, but before you could answer...
- Hello! - You heard from behind... What? A speaking snowman?
- Would you like some hot tea? You two look tired. - he said cheerfully.
And then quickly added: - You can pay with snow! - he smiled widely.
- Whoah, pay with... snow? - You were unable to hide your surprise.

The players are wandering in a magical winter land, and their most important quest is to find a way home. In order to do that they have to help some peculiar locals with their tiny little problems while looking for the magic snowglobe as well, which will be able to send them home when they finally reach the Christmas tree. The players start their journey in front of a snowman's hut, where the adventure begins, exploring objects and mysterious piles of snow, finding useful tools, and winding up in all kinds of challenging situations. Meanwhile, it is snowing continuously, which sometimes might be helpful, but other times it blocks their way. As time goes by, the weather gets drearier and drearier, fog and immense snowdrifts could close off the players' paths. Time passes differently in this unusual world, too. Ten minutes here is a whole day in the real world, so they must hurry with their mission to get home by Christmas Eve. At least that's what the snowman in the hut said, and I really hope he was right.

—description from the designer

The standalone expansion of 72 (ãªãªã˜ã‚…ã†ã«) (72 Demons of Goetia)

You can play with the base game of this game alone.  This game is specific for 2 players but can be mixed with the base game to support 4 players.  It also has 8 randomizer suit cards to select # of player + 2 suits.

This expansion has 4 additional suits and a new effect "cut-in" (interruption) (blue text) to respond to the effect of other cards.  In addition, there is a very special card - Phoenix.

It comes with additional clarification rulesheet for the base game.

In this game, you are a leader of a group of fantastic creatures in a world where civilization is surrounded by creature-infested wilderness. Your goal is to get the biggest number of creatures in your group. At the start of the game the players decide on a number of creature that they need to get to win and the first player to get those creature and return to start wins. In the setup cards are distributed into numerous piles. Each turn, players can travel to adjacent piles and decide whether to encounter a creature there. By putting forward the best creatures for each encounter, you can befriend and recruit new creatures or battle and subdue them. Your success depends on whether they like each other, what the creatures are good and bad at fighting, and what type of creatures they are. Remembering the characteristics of the other creatures that have been encountered can help you to strategically match creatures in an encounter so as to grow your group. Players may also encounter each other and trade or battle.

600 game cards, challenges, awkward scenarios & accessories (Amazon Exclusive)

Think you’ve got what it takes to be one of the Jokers? Now’s your chance to put yourself to the test with the Impractical Jokers game. Whether you like pulling off undercover challenges on friends or just laughing at hilariously awkward card combinations, this game has something for you. Phase 1: Mess with unsuspecting friends and family. Phase 2: Match uncomfortable scenario cards with hysterical action cards. Phase 3: The Punishment.

Hold onto your butts! A hurricane is closing in and the Park is in danger. In this The Game of Life Jurassic Park Edition board game, players race around Isla Neblar, collecting Dinosaur Eggs and rescuing Park Rangers as the storm advances and dinos escape! Jurassic Park fans will love the nostalgic nod to the film with blockbuster-inspired twists and turns. Move around the island and draw from interactive cards featuring quotes, characters, and iconic objects from the original film. Be careful! Hungry dinos lurk everywhere! Played in 15 rounds, players have 2 ways to escape the island. Who will play it safe and who will risk it all to save more Eggs and Rangers? Escape the island and get 1 point for every Egg token collected and 3 points for every Ranger in the SUV. The player with the most points wins. This family board game is for ages 8+, and it's a fun choice for a family game night.


     THE GAME OF LIFE JURASSIC PARK EDITION: Fans can celebrate the nostalgic classic film and favorite movie moments with movie-related details, gaming components, and a dynamic unboxing experience
     WILDLY-DIFFERENT GAMEPLAY: Life finds a way! A hurricane is headed to Isla Nublar. In this immersive gaming experience, players collect dinosaur eggs and park rangers, and try to leave the island before the storm hits
     GAME-CHANGING DINO TOKENS: Dinosaurs now roam the park! In this fun board game for ages 8 and up, players avoid the dinos and try not to lose eggs and park rangers as they race to escape the island
     ESCAPE THE ISLAND TO WIN: For the first time ever, players finish this The Game of Life game in 15 rounds. Those who don't will be stuck on the island with hungry dinosaurs as the hurricane hits
     FAMILY BOARD GAME FOR 2-4 PLAYERS: This family-friendly game features perilous blockbuster-inspired twists. It's a great gift for old and new Jurassic Park fans. The game is for adults and kids ages 8+


—description from the publisher

A slightly new take on variable strength chits (more granular with up to 5 steps per unit vs. the usual three) covering more obscure battles of the Eastern Front. This is the first entry in a three part simulation of the failed Soviet offensive to eliminate the salient of the German Ninth Army during the winter of 1942-43 known as Operation Mars (25 Nov - 12 Dec 1942). Players will conduct operations as either Soviet Direction Commander Zhukov or the German commander of the Ninth Army, Model. Several possibilities existed given the terrain and the weather situation and some of these will be possible to explore with this game. Included are some hypothetical options that could have altered the outcome. This work is primarily based on Zhukov's Greatest Defeat by David Glantz with some OOB fleshing by Nafziger and maps based on post-war USGS surveys (which were themselves taken from wartime Soviet surveys).

Each volume has one 22"x34" mapsheet (using 20mm hexes to be less cramped) with all three volumes able to link together covering 43" x 48" total area at 1.5 miles/hex and one day per turn.
Each game uses 0.6" counters of mainly German battalions and Soviet regiments or brigades - the first volume (Belyy) has 352 counters with two double-sided and three single-sided PAC accompanying a 18 page rule book, the second volume (Olenino) has 440 counters with three double-sided and two single-sided PAC accompanying a 20 page rule book, and the final volume (Konev) will have 528 counters with three double-sided and three single-sided PAC accompanying a 20 page rule book.

Included scenario:
Belyy - Volume I - #1 Belyy Thrust - The included scenario provides the players a look at the attacks of Soviet 41st Army which managed the best gains of the operation. The goal of this scenario is to present players with a fluid breakthrough and timely reinforcements. Both sides hoping their command decisions will carry the day. Scenario Duration: Turns 1-10 (25 Nov - 4 Dec) on Map KS.

—description from the designer

In this new edition of Clue, you will solve the mystery with the help of the ghost of Mrs. White by using Amazon Alexa.

Which suspect is responsible for the murder of Mr. Boddy in his mansion? Investigate who did it, which item they used, and the room where they committed the crime. Players have the option to summon the ghost of Mrs. White. If she's in a pleasant mood, she might help solve the case. If she's not… watch out!

Clue/do is a murder mystery game. The aim is to find out who committed the murder, which weapon they used, and where in the mansion they did it. How do you solve the case? By careful questioning of your fellow players you can deduce which information is concealed in the crime envelope. The trick is to be clever with your questioning.

Roll doubles to summon the ghost of Mrs. White. Just say, "Alexa, ask Mrs. White." If she's in a good mood she might help you advance in the game. But if she's not, she could very well say, "Hah! You thought your day was going well, but that's over now," and will give help to another player instead.

—description from the publisher

The most deadly and popular arena, Killosseum, draws in a huge daily crowd where people come to watch gladiators battle for their lives. A lot of people also make a living betting on these fights to the death and it is a spectacle for all to enjoy. In the game of Killosseum, you will be playing as a Lanista. As the Lanista you will make bets on matches and have your own gladiator fight in your honor. Your goal is to make as much money as possible and be the first person to gain enough coin to be crowned the most affluent Lanista of the arena.

—description from the designer

Using the latest genetic technologies, you will fulfill your dream of creating a cretaceous park! To do so, you will place dinosaurs in your park to attract tourists. But be aware of rival parks, attacks will be constant! Who will get more tourists?

Each player starts with a hand of three dinosaur cards. There are two common stacks: one for dinosaurs and another one for tourists.

Players will make turns and in their turn they will follow these two steps:
1.Draw one card: a dinosaur or a tourist.
2.Do one action choosing between these two options:
 2a.Expand your park by placing one dinosaur in it.
 2b.Attack and steal one dinosaur from another park using one stronger dinosaur from your hand, which will be discarded afterwards.

When you get two dinosaurs of the same type in your park, a tourist will come to see them and give you profits so you can take another dinosaur card from the common stack.
When you get three dinosaurs of the same type in your park, you can place a Ranger that will protect dinosaurs and tourists in that group.
When you get four dinosaurs of the same type in your park, you can steal a tourist from another park.
After an attack, if a carnivorous dinosaur is left without a partner it will eat its tourist which goes to his owners' hand. The tourist also goes to his owners hand when the last herbivorous dinosaur from a group is lost.

When both common dinosaur and tourist stacks are depleted, a last round is played and then the game ends. The park with more tourists is the winner.

-description from designer

Draw puzzle pieces from the bag and put together scenes from Disney’s holiday classic. But draw too many and the clock may strike! Hurry to finish all the pictures before Scrooge wakes up!

—description from the publisher

Using the cards you can assemble "Wally in the beach" or "Wally in the airport", with 16 cards each in a 4x4 matrix.

The first player who finds Wally gets 10 points. But there are other 10 questions (1 point each) that you have to answer finding the information in the cards

Unlock! is a cooperative card game inspired by escape rooms that uses a simple system which allows you to search scenes, combine objects, and solve riddles. Play Unlock! to embark on great adventures, while seated at a table using only cards and a companion app that can provide clues, check codes, monitor time remaining, etc.

Unlock! Extraordinary Adventures includes three separate scenarios for you to explore:

    Restart
    Hollywood Confidential
    W.A.F.F.'s Odyssey


Note: Unlock! requires a free application to be downloaded from the App Store or Google Play. Once downloaded, an internet connection is not required during game play.

—description from the publisher

ÐžÑ…Ð¾Ñ‚Ð½Ð¸ÐºÐ¸ ("Hunters") is a family board game, where each player need to trace a prey on prehistoric hunt. When a player turns a tile, he compares the power of animal and hunter. It's a world of saber-toothed tigers, woolly rhinos and a tribe of hungry hunters.

The game hase three modes: competitive, cooperative and command. All the tiles are placed on the table, this is a hunting field. A player makes following actions:

1. Turns over 2 tiles on the hunting field.
2. Evaluates the results of hunt. If it's possible, make additional actions.
3. Take the tiles, if the hunt was successful (matched), or turn back the tiles, if the hunt was unsuccessful.

A player wins in competitive mode if he has more hunted tiles or has the highest values of tiles. In cooperative mode, players need to collect a certain number of tiles in 30 rounds.

When Beth Ferris-Hendricks’s death is declared an accident in the small town of Mallory Rock, Maine, her sister Gwen sets out to prove Beth was murdered. Gwen, having grown up on the New England island, must investigate the residents she has known all of her life.

To catch the killer, Gwen will need your help to expose her hometown and uncover the secrets that exist on Mallory Rock.

Difficulty: 3/5

ã‚¢ãƒªã‚¹ã¨3ã¤ã®éµ ("Alice and the 3 Keys") is a free PnP game from Japan.

Alice is lost in a mysterious world, and it's up to you to help her escape through the power of playing cards!

This is a cooperative game in which you must help Alice, who is trapped in a mysterious world, get the three keys to return to her world. Alice will have the help of the card players because she can't stop until she runs into something. But don't let the wary Queen find you.

If Alice can obtain the three keys on the board before all the cards in her hand have been used up. Alice will escape from the Queen and return home with her sister.

You always try to keep up with the latest home-decorating trends, and now that might pay off if your home catches the eye of a judge from Decor Rate magazine. You could win a prize and have your home featured in their publication.

Players start Ulterior Design by revealing one current trend card face up in a central area, then they place one card from their hand face up in their area. On each turn after that, a player plays one of their three hand cards to add to their own house (redecorate), to influence what is trending (by adding a card to the central area), or to sabotage a rival (by adding their card to an opponent's house). Cards are split down the middle with some combination of interior decorations (houseplants, paintings and lamps) on each half, and they must be played so that they overlap at least one half of an already played card.

To end their turn, they refill their hand, then reveal an event card, which may be a judge, a reshuffle, or crickets. Judges are looking for the right number of plants, portraits, or lamps. The player who most closely matches the total number of items in the current trend receives an award; in a tie, the award goes to whoever played least recently as they were trending before it was cool.

The first player to collect three awards wins.

Lead a band of mutant Stalkers into the Zone and fight others to scavenge artifacts from the Ancients. Stake out your claim in the post-apocalyptic wasteland – or die trying.

Zone Wars is a fast and furious game of tabletop skirmishes set in the Mutant: Year Zero universe. Zone Wars is all about embracing mayhem and emergent narrative to create a fun and fast-flowing experience.

Everything you need for two players is included in the Zone Wars Core Set, including top quality 32mm miniature figures, rules, scenarios, terrain, dice, cards and tokens.

In Service Please! You play against friends and family in a food war of gastronomic proportions!

Collect Food Prep cards as you attempt to gather the ingredients needed to create the Dishes ordered. Manage your hand, try to slow down the competition, and cook your way to victory!

The winner of Service Please! Is the player who gains the most stars from completing the drafted dishes, with more complex meals gaining you more stars!

Who wants a slice of that victory pie?!

—description from the designer

Collect matter from the far corners of the Galaxy and fill the Wormhole at the centre before the ever increasing Voids consume the board!

Play solo, as a team or in competitive mode to collect cards and bridge, boost and warp your way to victory.

A good memory will help you find the cards you need, but with a limited hand, will you play it safe or push your luck?

The more cards you play, the more Voids appear...so choose your path wisely!

—description from the designer

In Only One Collection, players are collecting cards hoping to have the most of each type, and the player on their right to have the second most!

On their turn a player can either add a card from the deck to a set on the table or take a set.  A player cannot add a duplicate number to a set.

The game ends when a certain card is revealed in the deck.  Then, the player who has the most cards of each number earns 1 point and then earns 1 point per card of those numbers held by the player on their right.

The person with the most points wins.

Girls, boys, tomorrow is our big day.  The day of the Dead!  Aren't you glad?  What happen to you?  Oh yes, our friends the monsters will not come… They go out tonight to look for candy and tomorrow they will be tired.  We throw some epic parties and they'll never know!  Unless…
You must take advantage of the rolls of the dice, yours and your rivals, to get the treats that each monster likes the most, move from neighborhood to neighborhood and invite them to your party.

Be careful because not all monsters want to be close to what others... Although that's not a problem for a professional party skeleton like you, right?

Also, you can always use the help of the pumpkin to change your luck.

Cruel Necessity is a solitaire game simulating the military, political, and religious struggles of the English Civil Wars. You attempt to stop the advance of four armies bent on destroying Parliament and Puritanism, whom you represent. Simply holding on to London is not enough; you must also suppress the enemies of Puritanism, Parliamentary Government, and English domination.

There are civil wars going on not just in England, but in Scotland and Ireland too; and each will have varying impact on the play of the game at different times.

The title comes from the purported response to the beheading of King Charles by his implacable foe, Oliver Cromwell, who remarked that this act of regicide was a “Cruel necessity.”

Deluxe edition changes:
This is a deluxe new edition of the classic solo game. It will be printed with super high quality components.  The box, board, and counters will be thick and mounted.  The player aids will have the largest font possible and be on nice quality card stock.

The values, and thus the impacts, of the Achievement cards have been changed. Errata from the classic VPG edition has also been included.

Game contents:
One full color Rulebook including designer's Notes
One large mounted game board
One Player Aid
75 cards
One sheet of thick, two-sided, multi-shaped game pieces
One blue (Parliamentary) 6-sided die
One red (Royalist) 6-sided die

Stitch is ready to celebrate Christmas but he can’t contain his excitement. With each uncontrollable outburst, Stitch unwraps more and more presents. Choose which presents to try to sneak past Stitch. Then roll to find out which gifts he unwraps. Save the most presents to win! Who can save the holiday from Stitch’s mischief?

Push your luck choosing which presents to play. Watch for naughty and nice Stitch faces that affect how often you roll the die and how likely Stitch is to unwrap your presents. Custom die and watercolor-style card illustrations bring this fanfavorite character to life on your table!

—description from the publisher

Kitten Dinner is a family game for 2-5 players, ages 8 and up. Can you feed the hungry kittens their dinner to win the game?

IT'S DINNER TIME!
Hungry kittens wander the streets. Can you lure them back to your warm home with the promise of good meal? If you feed enough kitties their dinner, you win!

COLLECT YOUR CARDS!
Roll the dice and decide which direction to move the Kitten mover around the circle of Kittens. Collect cards equal to the number you've rolled and add them to your hand. Don't roll all blanks or a kitty will get away!

FEED THE KITTIES!
Lure the Kitties back to your home by matching their symbols. Spell D-I-N-N-E-R using your food cards to feed the Kittens and earn their point value.

HOW TO WIN: The player who feeds kitties and earns the predetermined points (9-21 depending on player count) wins the game.

—description from the designer

Blabbi is a game of made-up words.

Overview:

Blabbi is a game of made-up words! Rack up points by coming up with imaginary words using topic cards, then let your buddies decide if your definitions are gold or goof!

––––

How to Play:

Blabbi is a party crosswords game where every word is entirely made-up!

On your turn, use any number of your 8 letters and 3 topic cards to invent a fake word and pitch a definition on the spot.
But get ready to explain yourself because other players can ask questions about your word until they've voted: Yes (they believe it) or No (they don't buy it).

If the majority votes Yes, you keep the topic card and earn points.

At the end of the game, the player with the most points wins!

• Easy to learn to start playing in 2 minutes or less!
• Great news for bad spellers: Blabbi is a twist on word games that leans more on humor and creativity!
• Designed for people who hate rules, so play how you want and in any language you want!
• Never gets old. Blabbi is all about language creativity, so you’ll never play the same way twice!
• Big on content? Our box includes a built-in phone stand to record your favorite definitions.

Game Details:
Players: 3+
Age: 12+
Set Up Time: 2 mins
Game Length: 30-60 mins
Type: Word Game / Improv Game / Party Game
Difficulty Level: Easy
Ideal for: Creatives, storytellers, actors, and everyone in between.

What’s in the Box:

100 Squishy Nonslip/Waterproof Letter Tiles
80 Oddly Specific Topic Cards
8 Voting Cards
1 Built-in Phone Stand

Dimensions:
9.9" x 7" x 2.4"

—description from the designer

Planepita is a dexterity game where players flick discs onto a central playing area. Discs in inner rings are worth more points than discs on outer rings.

One side of the discs is magnetic, as is the board.  After a player flicks their disc, they may turn it face down, so that the eye of the piece is not visible and the disc is more firmly attached to the board.  A face up disc is more valuable than a secure face down disc.

However, after all players have flicked their discs, any discs that are face up in the same ring as a neutral piece are removed from the board.  Then, by ring, players score points for having the most value of discs present.

The player with the most points after 4 rounds wins.

Soularium is a roll-and-write game for any number of players (1 - ∞). Your goal is to build Heaven & Hell from scratch, respectively endowing them with various resources such as: Angels and Demons; Virtues and Sins; Pure Souls and Dark Souls. And, somewhere in between, there is the Purgatory. A key element of the game is trying to avoid Celestial Imbalance by not overpowering one of the two Eternal Places.

A new mercenary card.

Special ability: Plagoue and Spread
Khan Queso comes bearing the Plague ability, spreading danger across the battlefield as he advances. It is possible to even chain Plague across multiple units with clever positioning, causing all sorts of mayhem around the battlefield!

—description from the publisher

The Star Wars: Shatterpoint game lets players alter the fate of the galaxy from the Core Worlds to the Outer Rim.

To start, each player builds a strike team of iconic Star Wars characters, whether thematic squads straight from the Star Wars galaxy such as Ahsoka Tano and Bo-Katan Kryze, or Lord Maul and his loyalist super commandos, or a custom squad that's optimized to complete the various mission objectives for the current game. You then pit your squad against another one, using your characters' special abilities and diverse combat skills to control the flow of battle as you race to complete dynamically evolving mission objectives.

North Africa, 1942. The burning desert sands witnessed the fiercest tank battles of World War II. Imagine yourself commanding a squad of tanks and tank destroyers. Do you think you are more adept at tactics and strategy than your opponents? On the battlefield you will be able to prove it, because the action already begins with Tobruk.

90's Argentinian wargame.

Merit is a fast-playing, no luck required, skirmish style game in a hex based arena!

Take turns maneuvering your heroes on the map, battle to control powerful Realm Stones to unlock devastating new abilities, and unleash brutal attacks on your opponents’ heroes!

To win, either defeat all of your opponents’ heroes, or control each Realm Stone on the map.

—description from the publisher

Take part in the frenzy of trading in crypto, dealing with the 'pumps' and the 'dumps' in the most volatile way. There has never been a more wacky, back and forth trading situation than with crypto, especially now.

Hodl It is played in a group of 3-8 players, where there are up to 8 different coin cards in play for everyone to collect within a round. These coin cards come in sets, and in order to win the game, a player must endeavour to collect all of one set. They can however, also utilise wildcards mixed into the deck which can have a positive, or a negative effect.

As the round progresses, players are trading 1, 2, 3 or more cards at a time. These trades are likely made up of coin cards but can include wildcards that the player doesn't want in their hand by the end. In turn, they are aiming to collect the cards they need from other players from that trade, so effectively it is fastest person first providing they aren't blindly competing for the same coin card. The round ends as soon as one player has a full winning set in hand and claims 'HOLD IT'!

The round can be played in as little as 5 minutes, depending on how volatile you make your trades, providing they follow some simple rules such as all the cards being traded, are of the same suit. As the rounds can be so short, this is a game of score and how well you can build that score up over several rounds, with each potential win in a round being of a varied score in itself.

The game is solely played with cards within one card deck. There are no other components.

—description from the designer
